meanings.definition: A horizontal member at the top of a door or window frame.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter installed the crossheads above the doors.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to paint the crossheads to match the window frames.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to balance on the crossheads of the door.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the crossheads, holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The crossheads stood out, framing the entrance beautifully.

meanings.definition: A bar or beam used to connect the piston and connecting rod in an engine.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic tightened the crossheads to ensure smooth engine operation.
meanings.sent2: The old engine needed new crossheads to function properly.
meanings.sent3: The crossheads in the engine danced up and down with each movement.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as the crossheads, linking ideas together seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The crossheads in the engine were like the heart, connecting all parts.

meanings.definition: A heading at the top of a page in a document or publication.
meanings.sent1: The report began with a bold crossheads to grab attention.
meanings.sent2: Remember to include the date in the crossheads of the document.
meanings.sent3: The crossheads on the page seemed to shout the title to the reader.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas flowed from the crossheads, guiding the reader through the text.
meanings.sent5: The crossheads on the page were like a crown, announcing the content within.
